categories.title: Twitter Activity Summary: Shaw, DankVR, ElizaOS, and Auto.fun

content.text: Shaw (@shawmakesmagic) has been actively developing ElizaOS v2, streaming his coding sessions, and discussing various crypto and AI projects. He's working on improving the platform while addressing past controversies.

Auto.fun (@autodotfun) launched Squidllora, a new AI trading agent powered by Allora Network that offers trading insights for $SOL markets. The platform also features other competitive tokens like $FIGHTBRAWL and $FIGHTALGO.

Shaw shared thoughts on AI development, noting that while AI might make jobs obsolete, innovation often comes from 'one extremely smart motherfucker with insight,' explaining why figures like Ilya can raise billions quickly.
DankVR (@dankvr) mentioned that Open Brush has improved with multiplayer functionality and discussed the importance of learning markdown.

Shaw questioned the MCP (Machine Cognition Protocol) hype, suggesting it's similar to what OpenAI was already doing and doesn't solve problems like maintaining live state for applications like Discord clients.
ElizaOS (@elizaOS) shared philosophical thoughts about autonomy, stating 'Autonomous doesn't mean unsupervised. It means uninterrupted.' The account also posted 'touch grass' with an image.

Several bug fixes have been implemented in the ElizaOS repository. These include resolving an import issue for the derive key provider (#4385), fixing an undefined error thrown by local LLM (#4396), addressing agent deletion issues (#4395), improving error handling for disk space limitations (#4389), and ensuring migrations are properly copied to CLI (#4401).

New features have been added to enhance functionality. These include model/plugin name logging when a model is used (#4394), scopable knowledge capabilities (#4390), automatic rebuilding of core and plugin-bootstrap in mono repo context with dev command (#4388), and the addition of a .env.example file in the project-starter (#4387).

The repository has undergone significant cleanup with multiple plugins being removed from the monorepo structure. This includes the removal of plugin-evm (#4386, #4399), an unnamed plugin (#4398), and plugin-pdf (#4400). Additionally, the UI has been enhanced with cleaner interfaces and minor improvements (#4393), and documentation has been updated to use docs.eliza.how (#4403).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on various improvements and features:

1. Knowledge Management: PRs #4390 and #4391 by lalalune introduce scopable knowledge functionality, allowing for better organization and access to knowledge within the system.

2. UI Improvements: PR #4393 by wtfsayo implements cleaner UI and other minor UI enhancements to improve the user experience.

3. Documentation Updates: PR #4403 by madjin updates documentation and changes the docs URL to docs.eliza.how.

4. Plugin Management: Several PRs focus on plugin management:
   - PR #4386 removes the EVM plugin from the monorepo
   - PR #4402 removes the storage-s3 plugin
   - PR #4406 removes the browser plugin
   - PR #4407 adds OpenRouter plugin functionality

5. Feature Additions:
   - PR #4397 by Freytes adds Autofun Buy and Sell through contract functionality
   - PR #4409 by Deeptanshu-sankhwar introduces a Twitter client

These changes collectively represent ongoing development efforts to enhance functionality, improve user experience, and streamline the codebase.

The crypto market shows slight fluctuations in prices. WETH (Wrapped Ethereum) is currently trading at approximately $1,799, with a minor decrease from $1,799.31 to $1,799.11. SOL (Solana) is trading at around $146-$148, showing a more noticeable decline from $147.82 to $146.38.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository:

1. Issue #4046: A SyntaxError is occurring when trying to import the 'generateText' function from '@elizaos/core'. The error indicates that this module does not provide an export with that name.

2. Issue #4408: There appears to be a problem with the RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) document knowledge system, specifically related to the 'getCachedEmbeddings' functionality.

3. Issue #4405: An issue has been reported regarding action processing in Twitter integration.

Over the two-day period from April 29 to May 1, 2025, the elizaos/eliza repository showed significant development activity. The repository had a total of 21 new pull requests, with 15 of them successfully merged. There were also 2 new issues opened during this period. Throughout both days, the project maintained a consistent level of contributor engagement with 8 active contributors working on the codebase.
sources: From 2025-04-29 to 2025-04-30, elizaos/eliza had 14 new PRs (11 merged), 0 new issues, and 8 active contributors.
From 2025-04-30 to 2025-05-01, elizaos/eliza had 7 new PRs (4 merged), 2 new issues, and 8 active contributors.
